content.description: Stand start with a good undercling and good feet trend up and left through an awesome gaston hold, ultimately grabbing good holds on a rail above.
content.location: Hike up the main trail of middle Elden, if you locate The Hole Show, Primal Rage is approximately 300 feet above it right in the drainage directly past ‘Free Hugs’.

content.description: Squat start on an incut seam with good feet on the skirt, climb up and right featuring a unique toss to an incut crimp. Positive slopers make for an enjoyable top out.
content.location: Hike up the main trail of middle Elden, if you locate The Hole Show, Primal Fury is approximately 300 feet above it right in the drainage directly past ‘Free Hugs’.

content.description: Start on a huge hueco: crux revolves around a long deadpoint to a sloper on the lip... continue pawing your way up to a positive rail to finish... There is also a lower start dyno put up by Tony Disanto that may bump it up a grade. Either way this problem is awesome and the rock is pretty immaculate for Elden.
content.location: Hiking straight up the main middle elden canyon trail it is tough to miss... approximately 5 minutes past the Skeletor area and requires a little bit of scramble hiking.

content.description: Reach up to an awesome pinch, stab up to the crack and make your way to the top. Eases in difficulty after the first few moves.
content.location: From the Hole show / Main Trail look to the left. Fairly easy to find. Walking up and around this boulder to the right will lead you to the others.

content.description: Sit start hugging the arete and continue to give the awesome arete some free hugs, eventually climbing out right to gain some sloping crimps and balance your way to a positive hold and easy top out. The OG stand start is a bit more natural and is a touch easier, probably a better problem.
content.protection: 4+ Pads and a spotter is recommended
content.location: If you found The Hole Show, look up and left about 50 yards and find this one right in the drainage. Landing is somewhat treacherous.

content.description: Stand start on an opposing crimp and sidepull and jump up to an incut edge. Climb up and right and top out on the Apex.
content.location: Just up the hill and left from Hole Show / Haunt-a-crack

content.description: Stand start on two crimps, make a difficult stab to a pocket like hold. Rock continues to get better as you continue up and right on better holds... tough mantle.
content.location: From the main trail / Hole show continue past Haunt-a-crack. Boss Hog is directly behind Haunt-a-crack.

content.description: The Hole Show area is a nice cluster of hard boulders relatively close to each other. It offers both sun and shade and has a few nice warm ups sprinkled in. Most classic is the namesake of the area, “Hole Show” but more modern classics keep popping up over the years. I will update the area with more moderates and warm ups soon.
